title: Julius Hauser -- Documentation of FBI Investigations

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all reports of investigations of the loyalty to the United States of my late father, Julius Hauser (1914-2006).

Julius Hauser was employed by the Food and Drug Administration, first in Chicago and, after 1949, in Washington, DC, between the late 1930s and the mid-1960s.

On at least three occasions, beginning in the early 1940s and again in the late 1940s and mid-1950s, he was accused of being a communist subversive and disloyal to the United States. On each such occasion, he was found innocent of those accusations and loyal to the United States of America.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert M. Hauser
604 South Washington Square, Apt 2709
Philadelphia PA 19106
Email: rmhauser@gmail.com
Phone: 608-2094328

title: Efforts to remove books from Naval Academy library (United States Naval Academy)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Efforts to remove books from Naval Academy library (United States Naval Academy)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any document concerning the disposition, destruction, displacement, or removal of books from the Naval Academy library.

2. Any document reflecting the search terms utilized to remove books from the Naval Academy library.

3. Any communications to or from the Office of the Secretary of Defense concerning books at the Naval Academy library. 

4. Any communications to or from Vice Adm. Yvette Davids which mentions any of the following terms: library, book, books, DEI, diversity, EO, executive order, gender, ideology. This request does not include copies of news reports.

5. Any communications to or from Cmdr. Tim Hawkins which mentions any of the following terms: library, book, books, DEI, diversity, EO, executive order, gender, ideology. This request does not include copies of news reports.

These requests are limited to records generated on or after January 20, 2025.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, instant messages, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication. "Communications" also includes transcripts, videos, audio, minutes, notes, or other recordings of conversations, meetings, phone calls, or Zoom (or similar) meetings.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

REQUEST FOR EXPEDITED PROCESSING:

I request that this request be expedited under 32 CFR § 286.8(e)(1)(i)(B) for the following reasons:

1. I certify the following to be true and correct: My organization is primarily engaged in disseminating information. The Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression (FIRE) maintains a news website at https://thefire.org/news, through which its staff members regularly publish news stories and editorial content concerning the activities of governments, government officials, and other persons or organizations of public concern. I am a staff member of FIRE. I frequently write about matters involving the First Amendment and press freedom, including on FIRE's website. See, e.g., https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303. A substantial component of my duties as a staff member of FIRE is to obtain information through public records requests, including through the Freedom of Information Act, which I or my colleagues then share through FIRE's website and social media channels. I also publish news and other information of public concern via "X" (https://x.com/adamsteinbaugh) and "Bluesky" (https://bsky.app/profile/adamsteinbaugh.bsky.social).

2. The requested information concerns an actual or alleged government activity, namely the removal of books from a library due to their viewpoints or content.

3. The requested information extends beyond the public's right to know about government activity generally and instead has a particular value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis. The information pertains to a breaking news story of public interest. That issue has attracted significant media coverage. The information has value that would be lost if not processed on an expedited basis.

Media coverage evidencing the significant public interest in this matter includes:
https://www.nytimes.com/2025/04/04/us/politics/naval-academy-dei-books-removed.html
https://www.washingtonpost.com/education/2025/04/02/naval-academy-remove-400-dei-books/
https://www.foxnews.com/politics/naval-academy-tosses-400-books-from-library-following-trump-dei-expulsion-orders
https://apnews.com/article/military-academies-dei-hegseth-trump-ba9731f24b4eb4bd9c02b568209f97af
https://blavity.com/jackie-robinson-mlk-books-naval-academy-dei-ban
https://foxbaltimore.com/news/local/naval-academy-will-not-remove-dei-related-materials-from-library
https://dailycaller.com/2025/04/02/naval-academy-removes-hundreds-of-books-that-push-dei/
https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/policy/defense/3367284/naval-academy-removes-400-books-dei-directive-hegseth/
https://www.baltimoresun.com/2025/04/02/hegseth-addresses-naval-academy-ahead-of-reported-book-ban/
https://www.nbclosangeles.com/news/national-international/maya-angelou-memoir-holocaust-book-among-dei-purge-at-naval-academy-library/3671190/
https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/apr/03/naval-academy-dei-books
https://thehill.com/homenews/race-politics/5227843-naval-academy-library-books-dei-trump-hegseth/
https://thehill.com/opinion/national-security/5228318-the-navy-cant-fight-for-freedom-while-banning-books/
https://www.thecollegefix.com/u-s-naval-academy-removes-400-books-that-promote-dei-from-library/
https://saraacarter.com/naval-academy-removes-400-books-following-dei-crackdown/
https://www.academia.org/naval-academy-purges-dei-books-from-library/

REQUEST FOR A FEE WAIVER OR REDUCED FEES:

I request, under 32 CFR § 286.12(l), a waiver or reduction of fees for the following reasons:

1. Disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest because its disclosure would shed light on the operations or activities of the government. The requested information pertains specifically to the policies, procedures, and practices of senior Department officials concerning their interaction with the media, implicating the Speech and Press clauses of the First Amendment.

2. Disclosure of the requested information would be likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of those operations or activities. Disclosure of the requested information would meaningfully inform the public about the Department's activities and operations, as the information pertains to the policies and underlying information driving decisions by senior Department officials. Disclosing the policies and other information would demonstrate the bases for those decisions, which have attracted substantial public attention, as demonstrated by the articles and press statements cited above. That information is not in the public domain.

3. Disclosure of the requested information will contribute to the understanding of a reasonably broad audience of persons interested in the subject, as opposed to the individual understanding of the requester. The requestor is a licensed attorney who practices First Amendment law, including its application to members of the press. As such, the requestor will be able to effectively convey information to the public. Further, the requestor is a representative of the news media. The requestor and his employer, the Foundation for Individual Rights and Expression, gather information of potential interest to a segment of the public, turns that information into distinct works (including through its news website, located at https://thefire.org/news), and distributes that information to the public. The information requested here relates to information that is about current events or that would be of current interest to the public. The requestor's past publication record (in addition to FIRE's articles available at https://thefire.org/news) is available at https://www.thefire.org/news-archive?author=303.

4. The requested information is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. The requestor works for a nonprofit organization and the records are not sought for a commercial purpose.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Animal Cruelty Evidence Related to PBSO Case #06-25044752

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Animal Cruelty Evidence Related to PBSO Case #06-25044752
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting a formal request for access to and copies of all body worn camera (BWC) and in-car camera (ICC) footage, as well as video and photographic evidence related to the below-detailed incident:
 * Palm Beach County Sheriff's Office (PBSO) Case Number: 06-25044752
 * Nature of Incident: Animal Cruelty
 * Date of Incident/Arrest: March 28, 2025 (arrest date - incident occurred on or about March 19-20, 2025)
 * Time of Arrest: 07:40 hours
 * Location of Arrest: 8559 Boca Rio Rd, Boca Raton, FL 33433
 * Arresting Officer(s): Detective Eric Zadanosky and Deputy Sheriff Derek Harrison (identified from narrative)
 * Defendant: Gabriel Gustavo Martinez, Date of Birth: 08/19/1990
 * Victim: Matthew Avoletta
 * Animal Victim: Gypsy

This request specifically includes, but is not limited to:
1.  All BWC and ICC footage from:
    * Detective Eric Zadanosky
    * Deputy Sheriff Derek Harrison
    * Any other PBSO personnel present at the scene of the arrest, transport, or interaction with Gabriel Gustavo Martinez on March 28, 2025, related to Case #06-25044752.

        * To ensure a comprehensive search, please include footage from:
        * The time of initial contact with Gabriel Gustavo Martinez at 8559 Boca Rio Rd
        * The arrest of Gabriel Gustavo Martinez

        * The transport of Gabriel Gustavo Martinez to the PBSO District 7 substation

        * Any interactions with Gabriel Gustavo Martinez at the substation

        * The transport of Gabriel Gustavo Martinez to West Boca Medical Center

2. Any and all video footage of the alleged animal cruelty incident involving Gabriel Gustavo Martinez and Gypsy, as referenced in the case narrative.

3. All still photographs of Gypsy's injuries, as referenced in the case narrative.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Jonathan Colon

title: FBI FB 4.4.25

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI FB 4.4.25
communications.communication:
Dear FOIA Officer:

You are receiving this correspondence as a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. subsection 552. I am requesting the following:

Copies of all Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) records, documents, and communications responsive to Frank Rockwell Barnett, aka Frank R. Barnett (October 29, 1921 — August, 15, 1993; SSN: 331-12-6860). 

Mr. Barnett was the founder and president of the National Strategy Information Center (NSIC). The NSIC (EIN: 13-1973342), which incorporated as a nonprofit in the State of New York on November 07, 1962, and operated until March 03, 2016, was a think tank that advocated on national security strategy, low-intensity conflict, intelligence agency operations, and political warfare.

Mr. Barnett also served as the vice president and director of research for the Smith Richardson Foundation (EIN: 56-0611550) between 1955 and 1962, and was a member of the Committee on the Present Danger between 1975 and 1985. He helped to found the American Friends of Russian Freedom, an anticommunist lobbying group, in 1951 along with William Casey, who would go on to serve as the Director of Central Intelligence, and William Donovan, former head of the Office of Strategic Services.

Proof of death is not required as Mr. Barnett's date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Records System, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records related to the National Strategy Information Center, Smith Richardson Foundation, Committee on the Present Danger, and American Friends of Russian Freedom.

In the event that there are fees, I am willing to pay up to $100. Please advise if fees will exceed this amount so I might make an arrangement for requesting the records. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

I look forward to your response within 20 working days, as the statute requires. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Sincerely,

Robert Skvarla, Jr.

title: Public Records Request – Communications, Travel, and Contacts of Deputy Chief Eric Barden

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Public Records Request – Communications, Travel, and Contacts of Deputy Chief Eric Barden
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the Washington Public Records Act (RCW 42.56), I am requesting the following records from the Seattle Police Department for the period of June 1, 2023, to December 31st, 2024. 


1. All communications (including but not limited to emails, memos, letters, or phone logs, and text message) sent or received by Deputy Chief Eric Barden involving the City of Phoenix, Arizona, or any Phoenix-based entities (e.g., Phoenix Police Department, city officials), including any correspondence to or from email addresses ending in @phoenix.gov associated with the Phoenix Police Department.
2. All travel records, expense reports, or reimbursement requests submitted by or on behalf of Eric Barden for trips to Arizona, including flights, lodging, meals, or other costs paid by SPD or the City of Seattle.
3. Documentation explaining the purpose of any trips to Arizona by Eric Barden, including itineraries, meeting schedules, or justifications for travel.
4. Records of individuals or entities Eric Barden met with in Arizona, as known to SPD or the City of Seattle.
5. Any SPD records of contacts or communications between Eric Barden (Seattle PD) and Sergeant Michael Meelhuysen (Phoenix PD) related to Arizona or the City of Phoenix.
6). All communications, regardless of form (including but not limited to emails, text messages, letters, phone logs, or other correspondence), sent or received by Deputy Chief Eric Barden involving Lyft, the rideshare company, or its representatives (e.g., employees, legal counsel, or corporate contacts).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Kitchen

title: Public Records Request – Fatal Officer-Involved Shooting: Deputy William May & Timothy Jarvinen

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Public Records Request – Fatal Officer-Involved Shooting: Deputy William May & Timothy Jarvinen
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Custodian of Records,

Pursuant to Chapter 119 of the Florida Statutes (Florida Public Records Law), I am submitting this request for specific records related to the officer-involved shooting that occurred at or near the Dollar General in Mossy Head, Florida, involving Deputy William “Bill” May and Mr. Timothy Mark Jarvinen, resulting in the deaths of both individuals.

This request is being made in the public interest. Preliminary reports indicate that Mr. Jarvinen had no criminal history in Walton County or Northwest Florida, was a legal concealed carry permit holder, and had no record of prior violence. Publicly available information shows no indication of instability or aggression. In contrast, recent narratives claim the deputy was escorting Mr. Jarvinen out of the store and that shots were fired once both men were outside—with the deputy behind him.

Given this context, the public has a right to know exactly what happened and whether proper use-of-force protocols and de-escalation practices were followed. This request is made not to assign blame, but to uncover facts that matter for public trust and accountability.

Requested Records:
All body-worn camera footage and in-car video/audio from Deputy William May and any other deputies present at the scene.

911 audio recordings, dispatch logs, radio traffic, and CAD reports relating to the incident from the time of the call through the conclusion of the scene.

Full incident and supplemental reports, including witness statements, officer narratives, and scene diagrams.

All store surveillance video (Dollar General and surrounding businesses) acquired by law enforcement or reviewed during the investigation.

The complete personnel file of Deputy William May, including:

Use-of-force records (past and present),

Internal affairs complaints,

Disciplinary actions (if any),

Mental health screenings or psychological evaluations tied to employment,

Relevant training certifications, especially related to de-escalation or crowd control.

Any emails, memos, or internal communications referencing Mr. Jarvinen or this incident, dated between March 22, 2025 and April 5, 2025, including communications between deputies, supervisors, and public information officers.

The Spring Break deployment strategy or assignment roster, specifically indicating how and why Deputy May volunteered for the shift and whether Dollar General or similar retail disturbances were a known issue.

Note on Intent:
This is a deeply tragic event. Two lives were lost. But when both parties are deceased, it becomes the duty of the public—and those of us who serve the public interest—to ask:
“What really happened, and could it have been prevented?”

I request that all records be provided in electronic format where possible. If portions of the requested records are exempt or confidential, please cite the specific exemption and provide redacted versions of the non-exempt portions in accordance with Florida law.

Please confirm receipt of this request and notify me of any estimated costs prior to fulfilling it.

Thank you for your time and commitment to transparency.

Sincerely,

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alabama Times

CJ  Ciaramella

Boston, Massachusetts 02115

Dear CJ  Ciaramella: 
This notice acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) received on 4/3/2025.  Please use the following unique FOIA tracking number CBP-FO-2025-098464 to track the status of your request.  If you have not already done so, you must create a SecureRelease account. This is the only method available to check the status of your pending FOIA request. 

Provisions of the Act allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS FOIA regulations outlined on the DHS website, https://www.federalregister.gov/documents/2016/11/22/2016-28095/freedom-of-information-act-regulations. By submitting your request, you have agreed to pay up to $25.00 in applicable processing fees, if any fees associated with your request exceed this amount, CBP shall contact you. 
Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request.  Consistent with 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, CBP processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt.  Although CBP’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period in certain circumstances pursuant to 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(c). 

CBP’s FOIA Division is working hard to reduce the amount of time necessary to respond to FOIA requests.  We truly appreciate your continued patience. 
For additional information please consult CBP FOIA website please click on FOIA Act Resources or visit http://www.cbp.gov/site-policy-notices/foia. 

Please note that this message has been sent from an unmonitored e-mail account. Any messages sent to this account will not be read. 
Sincerely, 

U.S. Customs and Border Protection

title: Preston County Opioid Settlement Funds 3

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Preston County Opioid Settlement Funds 3
communications.communication:
Dear Nathan Raybeck:

Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that detail the use or allocation of opioid lawsuit settlement funds in Preston County and outline an application for these funds. I am also requesting any documentation related to the review or approval process for these funds, including the names of individuals involved.

Specifically, I am requesting documentation of the amount of funds Preston County has received so far, the application process to apply for funding, the individuals who will review the funding applications, the process by which funds will be awarded, how much funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of West Virginia’s allocations of opioid settlement funds. I am a representative of the news media and my request is related to news gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. You can call me at 304-216-6743 or send me an email at heiskell.hannah@gmail.com. My physical address is 1511 University Ave. Morgantown, WV, 26505.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,
Hannah Heiskell
304-216-6743
heiskell.hannah@gmail.com

Specifically, I am requesting documentation of the amount of funds Monongalia County has received so far, the application process to apply for funding, the individuals who will review the funding applications, the process by which funds will be awarded, how much funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of West Virginia’s allocations of opioid settlement funds. I am a representative of the news media and my request is related to news gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. You can call me at 304-216-6743 or send me an email at heiskell.hannah@gmail.com. My physical address is 1511 University Ave. Morgantown, WV, 26505.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

Thank you for considering my request.

Sincerely,
Hannah Heiskell
304-216-6743
heiskell.hannah@gmail.com

communications.subject: Police Records Request :: W687401-040325
communications.communication:
Dear Police News: 
 
   
  
The City’s AD 1.31 was signed on December 12, 2024. The City informed the Office of the Attorney General of the update on January 9, 2025. The City will implement the changes starting January 21, 2025. 
1. Texas Government Code Section 552.234(c) (the Texas Public Information Act) allows a governmental body to designate one mailing address and one electronic mail address for receiving written requests for public information. The City of San Antonio Administrative Directive 1.31, entitled Open Government, now provides the following methods to requestors seeking records from the City: 
 a. Via email: openrecords@sanantonio.gov 
b. Via the open government portal: https://sanantonio.govqa.us/webapp/_rs/(S(nzhdsq2jtkns5hfojy5kcmbj))/supporthome.aspx 
c. By mail to the City: Open Records Division of the City of San Antonio, P.O. Box 839966, San Antonio, Texas 78283. 
d. By mail to San Antonio Police Department: 315 S. Santa Rosa, San Antonio, Texas 78207. 
e. By mail to San Antonio Fire Department: 315 S. Santa Rosa, San Antonio, Texas 78207. 
f. Note, hand-delivery and in-person requests are permitted under the Act. 
 
2. The City is not required to respond to a written request for public information unless the request is received by one of the methods listed above (Texas Government Code Section 552.205). 
 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the City of San Antonio. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 4/3/2025 and given the reference number W687401-040325 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant City department(s). You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
In accordance with the Public Information Act, Chapter 552 of the Texas Government Code, the City of San Antonio makes all of its public records available to citizens. 
 
The Public Information Act does not require governmental bodies to create new information, perform legal research, or to answer questions. The request must ask for records or information already in existence. The City of San Antonio will not comply with a standing request for information to be collected or prepared in the future. 
 
The City of San Antonio will respond within ten business days following submission of requests. The City of San Antonio may collect a fee as prescribed by law for the requested documents. For more information on the Texas Public Information Act, please visit the Texas Attorney General Web site at www.oag.state.tx.us/open/og_faqs.shtml. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Open Records Center.

communications.communication:
Dear Police News: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Cape Coral Police Department Records. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Statute 119, Public Information Act. Your request was received in this office on 4/3/2025 and given the reference number C001538-040325 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request the following public records related to the arrests of Marlena Velez (DOB: [insert if known], Age 22), regarding two alleged incidents of theft from Target stores in Cape Coral, Florida:

All body-worn camera footage from Cape Coral Police Department officers related to both arrests of Marlena Velez:

First incident/arrest: related to the theft that occurred on October 30, 2024, with arrest and booking occurring shortly thereafter.

Second incident/arrest: related to the theft that occurred on November 20, 2024, with arrest on Saturday, December 2, 2024.

Rear seat camera footage from any Cape Coral PD patrol vehicle used to transport Ms. Velez during either arrest.

In-custody jail security footage capturing Ms. Velez’s statement, reportedly recorded during her first booking, in which she allegedly said “Lesson learned,” as referenced publicly by the department and in media coverage.

This request is limited to video/audio records captured between:

October 30, 2024 – December 3, 2024, for both incidents

Only those files directly associated with the arrest, processing, or transport of Marlena Velez

I understand some records may be subject to redaction, and I consent to the redaction of personal identifiers or unrelated third-party information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

title: OPRA Request – Full Bodycam & In-Car Footage: Liam Mahoney Arrest, Belmar Beach (August 20, 2024)

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: OPRA Request – Full Bodycam & In-Car Footage: Liam Mahoney Arrest, Belmar Beach (August 20, 2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request the following records:

All body-worn camera footage from any Belmar Police Department officer involved in the encounter and arrest of Liam Mahoney on August 20, 2024, on the beach in Belmar, New Jersey. This request includes video from initial contact through the time Mr. Mahoney was placed into handcuffs at approximately 3:24 PM, and continuing through the conclusion of the incident, including any transport or field processing.

Any rear seat in-car video footage if Mr. Mahoney was placed in a patrol vehicle following his arrest.

This request is limited to footage directly related to Mr. Mahoney's arrest for obstruction, resisting arrest, and disorderly conduct. I understand bodycam footage has been publicly released in part; I request the complete, unedited footage for the full duration of officer interaction with Mr. Mahoney.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Police Cam News

communications.subject: OPRA Request
communications.communication:
We have received your Open Public Records Act Request. Please be advised
the Borough of Belmar now uses an online OPRA portal
https://belmarborough.nextrequest.com/. Your request will be uploaded into
this portal and you will receive an email confirmation. From there you can
finish creating your account so you can access your request. Your request
will be answered through this portal.* In the future please submit your
requests directly in the portal. *Thank you.

*Note: *Effective September 3, 2024, P.L. 2024, c. 16 requires all agencies
subject to OPRA to “adopt the form established by the Government Records
Council . . . for the use of any person who requests access to a government
record held or controlled by the public agency.” N.J.S.A. 47:1A-5(f).

 In accordance with this new requirement, the Government Records Council
(“GRC”) has established an updated version of the old "Model OPRA request
form" to include the following required items:

1) certifiable statements addressing commercial purpose and pending
litigation have been added to the “Requestor Information” box.

2) new and amended exemptions have been added to the “Reasons for Denial”
list, and

3) the information page has been changed to reflect relevant new and
amended provisions.

Requestors are not required to use an OPRA form, however, a written
equivalent not containing the form requirement of N.J.S.A 47:1A-5(f) and
N.J.S.A. 47:1A-5(g) may be denied by a custodian.
-- 

*April Claudio,* *RMC/CMC/CMR*
*Municipal Clerk/Registrar*
*Planning & Zoning Board Secretary*
*Technical Assistant to the Construction Official*

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera footage recorded by Collier County Sheriff’s Office deputies involved in the traffic stop, sobriety testing, and arrest of Mayor Teresa Heitmann following a reported DUI incident involving a damaged mailbox near her residence.

title: transgender deportations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: transgender deportations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Data regarding how many transgender people have been removed from the United States. The date range I'm looking for is 2021 to present. I want to know what states or territories they were picked up in, what facilities they were held in for how long, and what countries they were deported to. Did any of them die while in ERO custody/control?  Please make this data available as soon as possible. Thank you for your help.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari

title: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Pinal County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Medical Policies for Blood Borne Pathogens (Pinal County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to all staff—both medical and correctional—related to handling or managing prisoners with blood borne pathogens including but not limited Hepatitis C or HIV/AIDS.  This could be in the form of training materials on how to quarantine individuals with blood borne pathogens, or training materials for correctional staff on what to do when coming into contact with someone who has a blood borne pathogen. 

2- Any emergency preparedness manuals, directives, or training materials for when a viral outbreak occurs (this could also be referred to as a “pandemic procedure".)

3- Any medical directives, memos, regulations, or staff training around prescribing the medical protocol of PrEP (pre-exposure prophylaxis).

4- Any directives, regulations, manuals, memos, or other training materials given to staff on housing criteria for specific populations (e.g. women, youth, those with illnesses, etc.)

5- Employee handbook given to correctional staff upon hiring, as well as any employee handbook given separately to medical staff

I am also requesting the following data and forms:

1- Aggregate data by month on the number of prisoners with HIV and Hep C for the last two years. If this data exists only in a format that requires creation of a new record, please provide the data in its original format and remove identifying information.

2- A copy of the standard medical intake form used for prisoners or people held inside the facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Joseph Darius Jaafari
